item.title: Four Senior Technical Experts in Solar/Wind/Hydro/Biomass Sector
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
In the context of implementing the Annual Action Plan of 2014 for sustainable energy under the Global Public Goods And Challenges (GPGC) 2014-2020 the EC will finance risk capital in projects aiming at increasing and improving access to modern, affordable and sustainable energy services for poor populations.

The objective of the assignment is to contribute in successfully implementing the Action through a convertible grants scheme that is used for the first time in the EU development cooperation in Energy.

Four Senior Technical Experts in Solar/Wind/Hydro/Biomass Sector

Requested services: The Technical experts will offer their expertise per technology sector (solar/wind/hydro/biomass) regarding the projects' range of technical features and indicators that will allow tracking the projects' results.

Qualifications and skills: Master degree or equivalent in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering. Considering that the first degree of the Technical Experts is in engineering, a master’s degree in fields such as Economics and/or Environment would be an advantage.

Professional experience: The expert should have 10 years of general professional experience in the field. S/he will also have at least 3 years’ experience in sourcing, developing, constructing and operating projects in the solar/wind/hydro/biomass sector (mini-grids included), having provided his/her services to engineering and/or RES plants/RES applications construction/implementation company(ies) in developing countries and/or emerging markets and/or frontier markets. Proven experience in assessing procurement choices and ensuring that the proposed pricing, terms, warranties during the investment period can be benchmarked to industry standards is therefore necessary.

Work experience in the development of renewable energy investments in sub-Saharan Africa will be a particular advantage.

Proficient knowledge of English (both oral and written). Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Expert(e) Planificateur – Economiste (chef d'équipe) (Catégorie II)

Formation et connaissances linguistiques :

  • Formation supérieure d’économiste ou équivalent sanctionnée par un diplôme de niveau universitaire bac + 5 ou équivalent.
  • Toute formation complémentaire dans le domaine de la planification institutionnelle et budgétaire sera appréciée comme un atout complémentaire.
  • Maîtrise parfaite des logiciels informatiques les plus courants (traitement de texte et tableur).
  • Maîtrise parfaite du français.

Expérience professionnelle :

  • Expérience professionnelle d'au moins 6 ans dans le domaine de l’analyse et planification institutionnelle et budgétaire ou équivalent.
  • Expérience professionnelle dans le domaine dans les pays en voie de développement d'au moins 6 missions ou 2 ans.
  • Toute expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de planification, suivi et analyse électoraux ou équivalent sera appréciée.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicolas_fichers@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
